result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--serve 12 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence. The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for two years

--3 days credit for time already served given

miscConds.notes:
Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $543 less posted $150 cash bond=$393, plus attorney fees.] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

**8/11/22: Per Court's order at sentencing and Attorney Huebner's Final Statement of Hours, Defendant to reimburse attorney fees in the amount of $170, in addition to attorney fees assessed on original Judgment of Conviction.**

--no acts or threats of violence

--no possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

--to take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by a treating physician

--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of the Agent

--no possession or ingestion of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per the Agent

--to complete a certified Batterers Intervention programming or an alternative as approved by the Agent. The Court would prefer for the Agent to find a certified program, however if that is not available, then the Agent can arrange for the alternative program.  If Mr. Gutierrez completes the certified programming, then the DOC, at the Agent's discretion, can end the Probation term early.  If the certified program is not found, then the full Probation term is to be completed 

--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening 

--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/ elements and ccs

[MK] case called at 2:50pm  
Defendant Juan Gutierrez in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. The victim is present.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " is entered; factual basis stipulated including as to the Repeater status. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Gutierrez to:
--serve 12 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence. 
--3 days credit for time already served given

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--to complete a certified Batterers Intervention programming or an alternative as approved by the Agent. The Court would prefer for the Agent to find a certified program, however if that is not available, then the Agent can arrange for the alternative program.  If Mr. Gutierrez completes the certified programming, then the DOC, at the Agent's discretion, can end the Probation term early.  If the certified program is not found, then the full Probation term is to be completed 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening 
--no possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia
--to take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by a treating physician
--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $543 less posted $150 cash bond=$393, plus attorney fees.] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.
The Court finds that Mr. Gutierrez is not free to request expungement.  
The Court orders Mr. Gutierrez to report to the Jefferson Probation Office no later than 12:00 noon on Tuesday [7/5/22] 
recess 3:17pm

Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ml] Case called at 9:53AM
Defendant Juan Gutierrez in court, without counsel. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
The Defendant advises that he would like an attorney, but voices uncertainty in how to proceed.

The Court proceeds with completing an Adjourned Initial Appearance:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited..

The State advises that a letter from the alleged victim is on file, and notes that it takes no position in relation to the Defendant's request.

The Court modifies the Conditions of this Bond, striking the No Contact Order, replacing it with No Violent Contact and No Discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1. All other conditions remain the same.

recess 10:02AM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/05 at 3:00PM
Court's Response to 3/21/22 Letter: you may appear in court on 4/7 to state your reasons on the record.
from Third Party re: No Contact Provision
Scheduling Order
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:35PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Juan Gutierrez appears. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att Flint verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
This hearing is scheduled for an Initial Appearance, however the Defendant does not have counsel.

The Court inquires if there is a Victim present that would like to be heard. A Victim present makes a statement.

As the Defendant does not have counsel, the Court sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel hearing.

The Court requires a $150.00 Cash Bond (posted on 01/17/22) with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1 (the Defendant may return to the residence one time with the accompaniment of a Law Enforcement Officer to retrieve what is personally his; Law Enforcement shall afford the Defendant no less than 60 minutes at the residence)
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--report to the Jefferson County Courthouse, Room 115, no later than 4:30PM today for the purposes of signing this bond

recess 1:42PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 04/07 at 10:00AM with in person appearances
